poem:
**Chile's Choice**

Measured voices cry  
beneath the Andean sun,  
a nation's heart  
tugs Southward.  

Walls and whispers,  
dust-stirred promises  
built on fear—  
a border's mirage.  

In ballot's shadow,  
hope flickers—  
a dance of light  
and dark—  
Chile sways,  
a fragile blossom  
in the shifting wind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Far-right José Antonio Kast favored to win as Chile votes in presidential runoff Chileans will head to the polls on Sunday for a presidential runoff in which the favourite is a Donald Trump-inspired candidate who has pledged to build a wall along the country’s borders to keep migrants out. José Antonio Kast, 59, an ultra-conservative former congressman who has built his campaign on a promise to expel tens of thousands of undocumented migrants, faces Jeannette". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
